1.verse: Paul, a prisoner for Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother: To Philemon our dearly-loved fellow labourer--

2.verse: and to our sister Apphia and our comrade Archippus--as well as to the  Church in your house.

3.verse: May grace be granted to you all, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I give continual thanks to my God while making mention of you, my brother, in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear of your love and of the faith which you have towards the Lord Jesus and which you manifest towards all God's people;

6.verse: praying as I do, that their participation in your faith may result in others fully recognizing all the right affection that is in us toward Christ.

7.verse: For I have  found great  joy and comfort in your love, because the  hearts of God's people have been, and are, refreshed through you, my brother.

8.verse: Therefore,  though I might with Christ's authority speak very freely and order you to do what is fitting,

9.verse: it is for love's sake that--instead of that--although I am none other than Paul the aged, and am now also a prisoner for Christ Jesus,

10.verse: I entreat you on behalf of my own child whose father I have become while in my chains--I mean Onesimus.

11.verse: Formerly he was useless to you, but now--true to his name--he is of great use to you and to me.

12.verse: I  am sending him back to you, though in so doing I send part of myself.

13.verse: It was my wish to keep him at my side for him to attend to my wants, as your representative, during my imprisonment for the Good News.

14.verse: Only I wished to do nothing without your consent, so that his kind action of yours might not be done under pressure, but might be a voluntary one.

15.verse: For perhaps it was  for this reason he was parted from you for a time, that you might receive him back wholly and for ever yours;

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but as something better than a slave--a brother peculiarly dear to me, and even dearer to you, both as a servant and as a fellow Christian.

17.verse: If therefore you regard me as a comrade, receive him as if he were I myself.

18.verse: And if he was ever dishonest or is in your debt,  debit me with the amount.

19.verse: I Paul write this with my own hand--I will pay you in full. (I say nothing of the fact that you owe me even your own self.)

20.verse: Yes, brother, do me this favour for the Lord's sake. Refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: I write to you in the full confidence that you will meet my wishes, for I know you will do even more than I say.

22.verse: And at the same time provide accommodation for me; for I hope that through your prayers I shall be permitted to come to you.

23.verse: Greetings to you, my brother, from Epaphras my fellow prisoner for the sake of Christ Jesus;

24.verse: and from Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with the spirit of  every one of you.
